lines:
WILLIAM READ & SONS, I 
Guns & Gun Materials,

MILITARY GOODS

1956

Paraddon 
a Moen

OF ALL KINDS. 
Fine Breech-Loading Double Guns,

FISHING TACKLE. 
107 WASHINGTON STREET,

BOSTON.

March 17, 1910.

Mr. A. E. Stearns, 
Phillips Ando ver,

Andover, Mass.

Dear Sir: -
Enclosed you will find money order for $1.14 which we

neglected to send when we sent the bill for Mr. Kwan. This was

Hoping you will excuse

an error in our Bookkeeping department. 
the delay, we remain,

Yours truly,

William Read & Sons,

per S.C.S.

March 17, 1910.  Mr. A. E. Stearns,  Phillips Ando ver,  Andover, Mass.  Dear Sir:Enclosed you will find money order for $1.14 which we  neglected to send when we sent the bill for Mr. Kwan. This was  Hoping you will excuse  an error in our Bookkeeping department.  the delay, we remain,  Yours truly,  William Read & Sons,  per S.C.S.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing a money order for $1.14, a refund on Mr. Kwan's account, due to a bookkeeping error.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
